captions.text:
Happy Valentines day, thugz. Today
we searchin for some mothafu**in’ truth
with Oedipus Da King by Sophocles.

Happy Valentines day, thugz. Today
we searchin for some mothafu**in’ truth
with Oedipus Da King by Sophocles.

When word comes from da Oracle of Apollo,
Oedipus finds out that da

murderer of the old king Laius come to town.
And if he wanna save his peoples from the
plague, that fool has. got. to. go.

When da blind prophet Tiresias
swangs in to Thebes, Opedipus axe dis fool

who dis mystery killa be. But since Mr. T
pity’s dat fool, he aint wanna tell him
the cold truth.

Oedpius be like “Man cut the
bullsh** and start talkin fool.” So Tiresias

oblige a brotha and say that OEDIPUS smoked
the ol king. Oedipus all like “WHAT YOU

Tired of gettin called out, dat blind prophet
starts runnin his

mouth bout how “ Yo Oedipus. Stop frontin.
You don’t even know who your parents are.

And when you do find da truth, it’s gonna
be lights- out playboy.

Then Oedipus’s hunny Jocasta tell
him not to pay that hater no mind;

First off, Laius killed by a crew
of gang bangaers. And second, some prophecies

don’t mean sh**. Laius was s’posed to
be merced by his own son, so he an Jocasta
tossed dat baby. S’all good now, right???

But after Jocasta describes where
Laius got shanked, Oeddy be all like “Oh

sh**. Now that you mention it, maybe I did
kill this fool. My bad.”

Back in the day, Oedipus cruised
over to Apollo’s Oracle and heard that one

day he was gonna merc his own daddy and pork
his MAMA. So our boy flips sh** and bounces

outta Corinth never to return. On the way
to Thebes, he wrecked some haters cuz they

got all up in his grill. Turns out, one of
those haters was LAIUS!

Then Oedipus gets the word from a
messenger that Corinth wasn’t actually his

original hood. Naw, Baby Ed was found at chillin
near a mountain. And according a nappy-ass

shepherd, Lauis’s son was dropped off at
the same spot! OH sh**! That means that Oedipus

been boning every HIS OWN MAMA!!! AND HIS
KIDS ARE HIS BRUTHAS AND SISTAS.

So they do the only logical thing:
Jocasta kills herself and Oedipus stabs his

eyes out with gold pins. Then Oedipus throws
up the deuce to all of Thebes and spends the
rest of his days wandering the earth.

This sh** right here is widely
considered to be THE dankest of all Greek
plays.

Even Sigmund Freud, the big daddy
of psychoanalytic theory, say errybody got

such a hard-on for this play cuz we all just
like Oedipus-

Lemme lay this on you playboy.
Sophocles droppin images of knowledge and

ingance on yo bitch ass like you ain’t even
know. For example, Oedipus’s name recalls

the Greek word “oida” which means “I
know” or “I have seen.”

Ever since showin out by solving
the riddle of the sphinx, King Eddy been gettin

mad props for droppin knowledge on all dem
Theben suckas. And now he got a big ol’

head cuz of it. But after gettin bitch- slapped
by the truth, our boy recognize that he don’t
know a damn thing.

So Sophocles spittin some top rank
paradox up in here. When Oedipus had his eyes,

he couldn’t recognize the truth. But when
dat fool blind as Tiresias, he can finally
see what’s up.

That’s a big-ass reversal son. In fact,
Aristotle was all up on dis

plays’ nuts cuz dat swole reversal, or peripateia
in ancient Greek: Cuz da playa who was askin

da question ended up being the answer, the
doc who was searchin for the cure, ended up
bein the sickness.

In a situation that fu**ed up, it’s
hard to believe the gods ain’t got his ass

on a leash. Hell, every single prophecy bout
daddy-slayin and mama-lovin turned out to
be the raw truth.

So if the gods got Oedipus’s game
on lock, does he get to do ANY shot- callin?

Some ivory tower G’s think he do.
In spite of all the whack-ass mess that Oedipus

gotta grind through, he still got the freedom
to chase da truth.

Every single step of the way there
be haters tellin him to slow his roll.

But Oedipus ain’t no bitch. He goes
hard in the paint and finds the truth even

if it means losin his throne, his eyes, and
ever getting a boner again.

So was it worth it? Maybe. But no
mater what you gotta give it up for our boy

Oedipus. Cuz chasin the truth may be the only
REAL human freedom we got.

Thanks for watchin. Make yo V-Day
extra hot with some Thug Notes swag. Be sure
to subscribe and word to yo mama. Peace.

title: Oedipus The King - Thug Notes Summary and Analysis

comments.author: SHMOOSTEIN

comments.text:
I love these videos, but as a student of psychology, I REALLY hate all the 
Freud references. That guy was full of shit!﻿
comments.author: D-Glad

comments.text:
+D-Glad I'm a philosopher myself ;) . I've written quite a bit and I think 
science is highly valuable in determining a productive, ethical and 
sustainable philosophy. It is of the utmost impotence to philosophy to have 
at least a basic core understanding of all scientific advances imho.

You have a nice day as well.
comments.author: fmlAllthetime

comments.text:
+fmlAllthetime Well, that's pretty much all that I (and the students and 
professors at my school) respect as well; psychodynamic and humanistic 
psychology are rarely mentioned, and are met with sneers at the concepts 
they bring up. I understand what you're saying about the variants in 
behavior, but I can all but guarantee behaviorists have already come up 
with an answer for whatever issue you have. I think all behaviorists at 
least acknowledge the neurological basis for behavior, even if they may not 
completely understand it.
But, of course, you're right; genuine scientific evidence is the way to go, 
and (to bring it all full circle) that's my main problem with Freud's 
theories, as they have no such evidence. Thanks, you too! Always nice to 
chat with another scientifically-minded individual.
comments.author: D-Glad

comments.text:
+D-Glad That's pretty much the only aspects of psychology I have respect 
for. The neuroscientific and chemical reasons. Some behavior stuff is 
legitimate, but it's outcomes can also be changed by cultural effects and 
childhood rearing. Once more variables come in, the more likely a fucked 
answer is (like always), so I think psychology and anthropology need to be 
practiced with respect to this. A lot of people don't, and secondly 
psychology is a branch of the medical feild, which is highly suspect to 
corporate rigging etc.

Non-biased hard evidence is always the best ;) , but I'm pretty fucking 
sure you already know that. Keep on keeping on my friend.
comments.author: fmlAllthetime

comments.text:
+fmlAllthetime True enough, many, if not most, disciplines of psychology 
are based largely on conjecture, if anything at all. Still, the 
neurological fields and behavioral science, which is the specialty at my 
college (Western Michigan University, if you're interested), are heavily 
based on real research and empirical evidence. For example, behavioral 
science is based almost solely on what can be directly observed (that is to 
say, an organism's behavior), and how that can be changed through the 
consequences. You will definitely get called out if you mention what an 
organism "wants" or "thinks" in one of my classes.
comments.author: D-Glad

comments.text:
+D-Glad No offense but psychology is still the most easily dismantled 
science in debate. It always will be until we have personalized maps of the 
brain and behavior that can be analyzed in that context. Did you know that 
conditions in the DSM were voted on? Shit, being gay was a mental disease 
up until the 70's. No offense but psychology is a joke when compared to 
physics or chemistry. I'm not saying it's useless either, just that 
psychology in America is different than psychology in japan and it really 
shouldn't be that way if it were universal (there are some similarities).

Secondly, what I said holds true no matter who said it. You could be a 
raging drunk and made the statement that was quoted and it wouldn't make it 
any less true or false. The statement always stands on its own merit ;)
comments.author: fmlAllthetime

comments.text:
+fmlAllthetime I know what you mean, and I suppose in the context of the 
Victorian era, he did good; he got people thinking that even mental 
problems were a thing that could be fixed, and opened up a whole generation 
to the idea that everyone is a sexual being, and that's not a bad thing. 
However, most, if not all, of his ideas have been scientifically shown to 
be wrong or to not help people at all, not to mention the whole "women can 
never be real people" thing, which is just nonsense. I'll always be a 
scientifically-minded individual, not a philosophy expert, so it bothers me 
when people associate Freud with modern psychology, which has become far 
more scientific.
comments.author: D-Glad

comments.text:
Just because some of his ideas were wack, doesn't mean everything he said 
was.

comments.author: Alex Phillips

comments.text:
I think one of the most interesting aspects of the play is that the 
audience is made aware of Oedipus's origins before the the first scene 
plays out. Because of this, the audience already knows where the truth will 
lead Oedipus, yet it still manages to be suspenseful and it provides one of 
the greatest dramatic Ironies in all of literature. ﻿

comments.author: Hancheng Wu

comments.text:
Pretty sure I already mentioned how dope this video was... Just wanted to 
add that Siggy Freud imo held the field of psychology back 50 to 100 years 
with his bullsh*t dream interpretation, developmental theory (oral and 
anal...), and of course sexual fixations. Hell even now psychology is as 
much an art as a science, but at least most schools are based on a 
behavioral model (since Skinner and other experimentalists). I'm sure we 
got a long ways to go before we unravel the mysteries of the mind, but that 
scrub Freud and his d*ck riders like Jung got it all twisted up. Hell even 
today old school psychoanalysts still taking peeps money with that 
unscientific b.s. in places like NYC, which just can't seem to let it go. 
Just wanted to chime in cuz I studied psychology for awhile in college 
before I decided to go the 'hard' science route, and part of why I bailed 
was that every psychologist seemed to have a pet theory, but very flimsy 
(if any) hard data to back it up. It's improving now, but still a lotta 
cranks out there. Sorry for the Tolstoy novel here, but I know you love 
your Russian lit, Sparky! Peace ;-)﻿

comments.text:
+Grief Machinicus It's based on falacy not fact. It's called the Oedipus 
conflict, and only is prominent in a child in the phallic stages of 
childhood (Around 3 years old) these feelings, if existent, subside way 
before you could remember.
comments.author: Aiden TheGreat

comments.text:
But sexual impulses must be understand widely here. Freud means every drive 
u have that makes u want. U have two drives in psychoanalysys - Eros and 
Thanthos - Eros is responsible for every feeling of love, desire, greed 
etc. and Thanathos is responsible for will to destroy and kill. Freud just 
points out that your sexual desire, greed, and need for beeing loved is 
constituted by one and the same drive, he calls sexual drive or Eros.
